page.title: 15FARMING & THE LOCK,TEMPLE
page.content: {THE LOCK AT TEMPLE The land around the lock is primarily pasture.The lock was built in 1890 and is owned by the Thames Conservancy.A lock-keeper's house is nearby.Approximately 200 boats pass through the lock daily during the summer.The weir is hydraulically operated.It features 14 main gates and 8 hand gates. {LOW GROUNDS FARM Low Grounds Farm is so-called because it is as low as the river and its flood plain.Farms called Low Grounds,Playhatch,Spade Oak and Hooks were originally 4 separate entities.They are now one farm company.There are 100 acres of wheat and 200 acres of grassland which supports 110 milking cows.
